snippet: In an apparent switch in its pricing policy, Amazon said over the weekend that it would allow users of its new Kindle Fire tablet to pay to turn off ads as it had done with earlier devices.
abstract: Amazon.com, in apparent switch in pricing policy, says it will allow buyers of its new Kindle Fire tablet to pay $15 extra to turn off ads that are built into the devices.
lead_paragraph: In an apparent switch in its pricing policy, Amazon said over the weekend that it would allow users of its new Kindle Fire tablet to pay to turn off ads as it had done with earlier devices.

headline.seo: Amazon Backs Down on Ads on Kindle
headline.main: Amazon to Allow Kindle Fire Users to Pay to Block Ads
headline.print_headline: Amazon Offers Users an Out On Kindle Ads
